intro: Spermacoce ostenii, commonly known as the African star apple, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Spermacoce ostenii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional medicinal uses in some cultures.
